segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sukkā bhikkhunī mahatiyā parisāya parivutā dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: Now, at that time the nun Sukkā was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.

segments.pli: Atha kho sukkāya bhikkhuniyā abhippasanno yakkho rājagahe rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
segments.en: Then a native spirit was so devoted to Sukkā that he went street to street and square to square, and on that occasion recited these verses:
“What’s up with these people in Rājagaha?
They sleep like they’ve been drinking mead!
as she’s teaching the deathless state.
it’s as if they drink it up,
like travelers enjoying a cool cloud.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: A spirit was full of faith in the nun Sukkā, so he went about the towns and villages encouraging people to listen to her teaching.
